lines.gurmukhi: crn kml mkrMd rs luiBq huie crn kml qwih jg mDukr hY
lines.transliteration_english: Charan Kamal Makarand Ras Loubhit Hui , Charan Kamal Taahi Jag Madhoukar Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: A Sikh who is engrossed in the elixir-like name of the Lord by virtue of the holy dust of the feet of True Guru (due to His company) has the whole world becoming his devotees.

lines.gurmukhi: sRI gur sbd Duin suin gd gd hoie AMmiRq bcn qwih jgq auDir hY
lines.transliteration_english: Sree Gur Sabad Dhouni Souni Gad Gad Hoi , Anmrit Bachan Taahi Jagat Udhari Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: A Sikh of the Guru whose every hair blooms hearing the melody of True Guru blessed Naam Simran, his elixir-like words can sail the world across the worldly ocean.

lines.gurmukhi: ikMcq ktwC kiRpw gur dieAw inDwn srb inDwn dwn doK duK hir hY
lines.transliteration_english: Kinchat Kataachh Kripaa Gur Daiaa Nidhaana , Sarab Nidhaan Daan Dokh Doukh Hari Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: A Sikh of the Guru who receives even a very small blessing of the True Guru, becomes capable of giving away all the treasures and allaying the distresses of the others.

lines.gurmukhi: sRI gur dwsn dws dwsn dwswn dws qws n ieMdRwid bHmwid smsir hY ]216]
lines.transliteration_english: Sree Gur Daasan Daas Daasan Daasaan Daasa , Taas N Indraadi Brahamaadi Samasari Hai ?216?

Shabad OS B.translation: A Sikh who serves the servants of the slaves of the True Guru (who becomes down to earth humble) cannot even be equated with god Indra, Brahma and all the gods and goddesses put together. (216)
